comment_regular_data.body:
@iphydf Can you update the TODO format to the following so when this get merged we get an actual issue and it doesn't get forgeted?

```c
/**
 * @todo Stuff to do
 * @body More descriptive text here so it gets appended to the issue.
 */
```
@iphydf If it's final decision, let's remove the second part of comment. If no -- let's discuss and remove code or comment.
@SkyzohKey if I do that, I have to wait another 30-50 minutes for circle ci to finish. Is there a way to teach the todo thing to look for TODO(name) instead of `@todo`?
@iphydf I guess you can configure it in the repo settings for the app. :/ Or push a [skip ci] commit ?
Ok, given that I had to remove a comment, I've made it `@todo`.
Skip CI doesn't work, because then the status checks will never complete.
@Diadlo done. All the comments gone, back to what it was.

Seems good. Alternatively, you could have updated the public API to reflect the change in the behavior, but I take you don't want to get into that for now. --- Reviewed 1 of 1 files at r1. Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, all discussions resolved. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/772#-:-L4q8H7g5FKrfcJy2v42:b-a46ncc)*

commit.message:
Reject discovery packets coming from outside the LAN.

Even if that means rejecting packets from ourselves if our IP is not a
"LAN" IP.
